page.title: 08BELLRINGING LT.WALTHAM I
page.content: Have you ever swung half a ton on the end of a rope? {Little Waltham Church}was where we did this.To get to the bellropes you had to go in to a room up a ladder through a trap door and into another room.This room had six bell ropes.The ropes had unwoven wool which is called a{sally}.We were shown how to make the bell go from the down position to the up.The lightest is called the{treble. The second is called second,the third, third,and so on until the sixth which is called{tenor.}If a bell is in the up position it is more dangerous because you are ringing.When down you only chime so it's easier. Lightest is the highest and heaviest the deepest.They use the numbers of the bells 1,2,3,4,5 and 6,so they know when its their turn in a tune.
